page.title: 20THE VILLAGE NAME
page.content: There are several theories about the way our village got its name. Maybe it is a corruption of Audimer _ the sound of the sea, or Outremer _ beyond the sea. But there is a legend which offers a more interesting explanation. In the early days when building of the church was first begun, unwisely down on the marshy land, the Angels took a hand and saw to it that wiser counsels prevailed in the choice of a site on higher ground. The foundations laid each day mysteriously disappeared each night. The pussled parishioners sat up to watch. They were amazed to see angels come and carry the stones across the water to the church's present site. 'O'er the mere, o'er the mere' they sang as they worked. So of course the church, and the village, were built o'er the mere at Udimore, or Udymer as the old spelling has it.
